Note: Participant finds that hand gestures are more responsive than in past sessions
Participant noticing that they could see general colors and figures while viewing an image within the display in direct sunlight but was generally difficult to see details and clear rendering
Participant zoomed in within the camera function under direct sunlight and could tell they were zooming in but could not discern specific details
Participant finds that zoom hand gesture / volume control gesture is unreliable in that it will work for some moments and in others, will fail to register within display
Participant finds that they could see objects in MR display clearly under the shade even if they were perceiving it in front of a white wall
Participant has noticed a delay between performing a hand gesture and the action actually occurring in MR display but has found no noticeable delay at this point
Participant having to manually zoom in by moving face closer to objects since zoom hand gesture is failing to respond
Images sent in WhatsApp are jumbled up with images that have been forwarded and sent by the user
Participant describes viewing environment through camera as disorienting while under direct sunlight as they are focusing intently on viewing lightened contents
Zoom function worked for participant in the 2 previous attempts
Participant does not notice rainbow glare while scanning outdoor environment despite being in sunlight yet, they had noticed this effect while watching reels in the car under sunlight
When standing under bright lighting, participant finds that they cannot see their environment through the glasses camera but can see it when they look through the non display part of the glasses
Participant believed that the part of the object being captured would not be visible in the photo they were capturing given its lack of visibility in their screen
Participant does not notice any physical heaviness while wearing the MR glasses
Participant theorizes that zoom function won’t work while standing in the sun
Participant expresses desire to zoom in on images sent in WhatsApp, especially as they are viewing image instructions for Lego building
Participant would rate the level of clarity viewing image instructions as 5/10 given the need to guess the specific location of Lego blocks in relation to each other
Participant finds that colors appear darker in the MR display as they were looking for a dark blue block when it was actually lighter blue
Participant was looking for a darker green block but noticed it was actually lighter
Participant is largely unsure if they are picking up the correct Lego piece as precise details are difficult to see
Participant is sitting in shade with no direct light hitting them

Participant expresses desire to be able to swipe seamlessly to the next photo when viewing images received in WhatsApp. Expressing slight annoyances about the need to click in and out of different photos

Participant notices that text is difficult to read as they are viewing Lego instruction within glasses display as the white numbers in the top corner identify how many specific Lego pieces are required
Participant is squinting and poking head forward as if attempting to see images more closely and identify specific details
Participant says it would be nice if the MR screen did not go to sleep so quickly
Battery at 15%
Screen is concentrated on the right side of glasses for participant

Participant was unable to to find a specific Lego piece because the images they were viewing made it “impossible to see the pieces were connected”, per participant. It does not help that participant cannot see numbers denoting how many pieces of the same Lego are required for that step
Participant is squinting and furrowing eyebrows as they analyze instructions on MR display
Glasses at 5%
Participant feels a headache as they’ve felt the need to intensely concentrate on clicking in and out of images to figure out what step they’re on
Participant also notices a headache from having to analyze images intently to identify how many pieces are needed for that step and where some pieces attach
Participant also noticing a headache from having to perceive green Lego pieces against green table cloth
Participant was unable to identify the correct piece because the color match was not clear between screen and tangible pieces
Glasses have died. Participant has glasses on and is scrolling through Instagram reels
Participant says they have not found glasses physically uncomfortable
